title: Miley Cyrus hospitalized, thanks her mother for helping her 'look a little bit better'
text:
Miley Cyrus hospitalized, thanks her mother for helping her 'look a little bit better' originally appeared on goodmorningamerica.com

Miley Cyrus has been posting a lot of major news updates on her Instagram Stories, but her latest is her biggest announcement yet: she's been hospitalized.

In a photo of her laying in a hospital bed, wearing a gown and strapped to an IV, the "Slide Away" artist revealed on Tuesday, "Trying to heal as quick as I can to make it to Gorillapalooza w @TheEllenShow @PortiaDeRossi @BrunoMars this weekend!"

Miley continues, "Hoping the Rock star G*DS send me a boost of bad a-- and help me kick this s--- to the cub where it belongs. We got gorillas to save!"

(MORE: Miley Cyrus shares empowering message after split with Liam Hemsworth: 'Change is inevitable')

She said on Monday that she is suffering from tonsillitis. It is unknown how long she will remain hospitalized.

.@MileyCyrus is currently hospitalized 🤒 Hope you feel better for Gorillapalooza (a Charity event) this weekend ❤️💉 pic.twitter.com/GSYlWZXagc — Miley Cyrus Access (@MileyNewsAccess) October 8, 2019

The singer looked quite refreshed in her hospital selfies -- to which she credits her mom Tish Cyrus in another Stories update.

"Thank you mama for helpin this little sickyyy look a little bit better by brushin my hair for me," she captioned the photo of her mom diligently brushing and hair-spraying away the hospital bed head.

Moms are the best! While @MileyCyrus is in the hospital fighting off whatever sickeness she has, her mom @tishcyrus made her feel better by brushing her hair ❤️ get well soon Miley! pic.twitter.com/s8ghnjuP84 — Miley Cyrus Access (@MileyNewsAccess) October 8, 2019

Cyrus also "redesigned" her baggy hospital gown by turning it into a dress -- shearing off the sleeves and creating a scoop neckline.

.@MileyCyrus redesigned her hospital gown and made it fashion 👗 pic.twitter.com/rAPuauUfFd — Miley Cyrus Access (@MileyNewsAccess) October 8, 2019

Gorillapalooza -- a charity event hosted by The Ellen Fund -- is happening this weekend to raise money and increase conservation efforts for endangered animals.
